se.jguru.nazgul.core.algorithms.launcher.api

Interface StandardLifecycle

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ApplicationLauncher
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractApplicationLauncher

    public interface StandardLifecycle
extends ApplicationLauncher
    ApplicationLauncher augmentation specification, defining a known set of lifecycle methods for implementation by the concrete application. The StandardLifecycle uses apache's commons CLI to define, parse and print help for command-line arguments.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      • Methods inherited from interface se.jguru.nazgul.core.algorithms.launcher.api.ApplicationLauncher

        printUsage

    • Method Detail

      • validateArguments

        void validateArguments(org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine commandLine)
                throws IllegalArgumentException
        Implement this method to perform any application-specific validation of the supplied CommandLine arguments. Such validation should focus on argument semantics, since the actual CLI argument parsing is already performed before invoking this method.
        Parameters:
        commandLine - The application command line.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any argument was invalid. Supply a human-readable error message within the IllegalArgumentException, as that argument will be read by the application launcher.

      • execute

        void execute()
        Main entrypoint to the application, which should execute the standard lifecycle methods in the following order: 
           try {
      // First, validate the given CLI arguments.
      validateArguments(commandLine);

      // Second, fire the actual application.
      runApplication(commandLine);
   } catch (RuntimeException e) {

      // Whoops.
      printUsage(e.getMessage());
   }
        Specified by:
        execute in interface ApplicationLauncher

      • runApplication

        void runApplication()
        Implement this method to execute the actual application. Throw a RuntimeException (or any subclass thereof) to indicate that the application was terminated improperly. A thrown RuntimeException is caught and handled by means of running printUsage with the exception message passed as message.
        See Also:
        execute(), ApplicationLauncher.printUsage(String)
